title: Textile, 1790–99
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block printed on plain weave
inscribed: Printed stamps at one end of the piece, "Bovet Robert H de neuchatel en Suisse Bon Teint" in elongated box; "D 2", "C 20" and "DC" all in black boxes at the side. There is some evidence of a red stamp at the lower right edge but fabric is torn in that area.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinor Merrell where is was No. 9 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions: Warp: 52 cm (20 1/2 in.). Weft: 86.5 cm (34 in.) Both selvedges present.
description: Exotic flowers alternate with twisted stripes. Quilted.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1790–99.
1790–99. Medium: cotton
Technique: block printed on plain weave. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-36.
